intro: Rudgea parquioides subsp. hirsutissima, commonly known as the hairy rudgea, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
